Cricetidae Muridae }} 'Muroidea' is a large superfamily of rodents. It
includes hamsters, gerbils, true mice and rats, and many other relatives. They
occupy a vast variety of habitats on every continent except Antarctica. Some
authorities have placed all members of this group into a single family, Muridae,
due to difficulties in determining how the subfamilies are related to one
another. The following taxonomy is based on recent well-supported molecular
phylogenies.

The muroids are classified in 6 families, 19 subfamilies, around 280 genera and
at least 1300 species.
